key_points: Tom Brady is considered the most successful quarterback in NFL history with numerous records.
Brady will play in Super Bowl 55 for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, aiming for another Vince Lombardi Trophy.
The Buccaneers, despite Brady's influence, still have a modest postseason win record.
Brady holds multiple Super Bowl records including most wins (6), games played (9), and MVP awards (4).
He also holds records for pass attempts, pass completions, pass completions in a single game, passing yards, and touchdown passes in Super Bowl history.
Brady has the opportunity to break more records at Super Bowl 55, including most NFL championships, most touchdown passes in a single Super Bowl, and most interceptions.
He is currently tied with others for the most NFL championships but can take sole possession with a win at Super Bowl 55.
Brady's personal best of four touchdown passes in a single Super Bowl is third highest, with the record at six by Steve Young.
Brady has thrown six interceptions in Super Bowl appearances, placing him fourth all time.
Despite playing in nearly double the number of Super Bowls as John Elway, Brady trails Elway in total interceptions thrown.
